chunks.zh: 淘宝的春节不打烊就是个笑话
chunks.en: Taobao's Spring Festival non-stop service is a joke.

chunks.zh: 我一月底二月初的快递，六七天了还没送到。
chunks.en: My deliveries from late January and early February haven't arrived after six or seven days.

chunks.zh: 三通一达已经提前歇菜了。
chunks.en: STO, Yunda, YTO, and ZTO have already stopped operating early.

chunks.zh: 明天过后菜鸟也歇菜了，都不知道就算派送了，快递员搁哪儿放。
chunks.en: Cainiao will also stop operating after tomorrow, and I don't even know where the delivery guys will leave the packages even if they deliver them.

chunks.zh: 总结就是迟早要完。
chunks.en: In conclusion, it's going to be over sooner or later.

chunks.zh: 就我观察来看，京东小哥每天依然忙忙碌碌，倒是没啥变化，次日达也很准时。
chunks.en: From my observation, JD delivery guys are still busy every day, with no changes, and next-day delivery is very punctual.

chunks.zh: 快递：淘宝不打烊关我快递什么事🤔️
chunks.en: Courier: Taobao's non-stop Spring Festival service has nothing to do with me. 🤔️

chunks.zh: 难道。。。。JD 就是买一个快递效率（ JD 就是一家快递公司），TB 就是买一个东西足够全么。。。
chunks.en: Could it be that... JD is for buying delivery speed (JD is a delivery company), and TB is for buying a wide variety of goods...?

chunks.zh: 一般常见的规格化的东西，去 JD 买隔日到，没有隔日谁还在 JD 上多花钱；而不是规格化常见的东西，JD 上也有很多第三方商家，用了非 JDL 也快不了，跟 TB 差不多，一般情况下还略贵；
chunks.en: For common, standardized items, you can buy them on JD and get them the next day. If there's no next-day delivery, who would spend more money on JD? But for non-standardized, common items, JD also has many third-party sellers, and using non-JDL doesn't make it any faster, it's about the same as TB, and generally slightly more expensive.

chunks.zh: TB 就图一个要啥基本有啥，再没有就得去小黄鱼了，至于时效，开玩笑“既要又要”啊。
chunks.en: TB is for finding basically anything you want, and if you can't find it there, you have to go to Xiaohuangyu. As for the delivery time, are you kidding me with 'wanting both'?

chunks.zh: 这个应该是基本认知？
chunks.en: Shouldn't this be common knowledge?

chunks.zh: 不打烊个 p 。
chunks.en: Non-stop my ass!

chunks.zh: 31 号买的东西，今天都没到。
chunks.en: I bought something on the 31st, and it hasn't arrived today.

chunks.zh: 2 月份下的所有订单都显示 2 月 19 号前发货。
chunks.en: All orders placed in February show that they will be shipped before February 19th.

chunks.zh: 转身就去 JD 重新买了，隔天到。
chunks.en: I immediately went to JD to buy it again, and it arrived the next day.

chunks.zh: @showgood163 我也不会问几天到，这个是蠢问题，商家不可能知道几天到。
chunks.en: @showgood163 I wouldn't ask how many days it will take to arrive; that's a stupid question. The seller can't possibly know how many days it will take.

chunks.zh: 但今年受过教训，我现在清楚怎么玩了，不需要问几天到，你只需要确认他是不是真的发货，如果想保险点，可以再问，他知道不知道收他快递的网店是不是真的有人送出去，这个他是可以知道的，如果说不清楚那我就不冒这个险了。
chunks.en: But I've learned my lesson this year, and now I know how to play it. You don't need to ask how many days it will take to arrive, you just need to confirm whether he really shipped it. If you want to be safe, you can also ask if he knows whether the online store that receives his delivery actually has someone sending it out, which he can know. If he can't explain it clearly, then I won't take the risk.

chunks.zh: 我上面那单就是，其实情况就是收件的那个破网点根本没人送去转运中心，只要有人送转运中心，后面的都不是事，剩下的就是你自己的点派不派了，所以你还要确认对方发什么快递和你那的快递什么时候停派。
chunks.en: That's what happened with my previous order. The situation was that the receiving station simply had no one to send it to the transfer center. As long as someone sends it to the transfer center, the rest is fine. The remaining thing is that you need to confirm which delivery company the other party uses and when the delivery company stopped sending around your area.

chunks.zh: 这几天我买的其它几个，甚至比平时还快，因为我在广东，高速往广东方向应该没车了，其他地方就不清楚了。
chunks.en: The other things I bought these days were even faster than usual because I'm in Guangdong, and there shouldn't be any traffic towards Guangdong on the highway. I'm not sure about other places.

chunks.zh: @showgood163 #7 上京东，次日达。
chunks.en: @showgood163 #7 Go to JD, next-day delivery.

chunks.zh: pdd 也是如此，最后我选了京东下单
chunks.en: Same with PDD, I ended up choosing to order from JD.

chunks.zh: 这个不打烊搞死商家，rnm 要营业到凌晨 1 点，傻逼玩意，还不能退出报名
chunks.en: This non-stop thing is killing merchants. We have to be open until 1 AM, what a stupid thing, and we can't even withdraw from registration.

chunks.zh: 发货照常，但快递根本不跑，不打烊没有实质效果，还折腾商家
chunks.en: Shipping as usual, but the couriers aren't moving at all. The non-stop service has no real effect and only tortures the merchants.

chunks.zh: @docx 我也觉得，如果收不到货，不如别折腾商家和顾客
chunks.en: @docx I agree. If the goods can't be received, it's better not to bother the merchants and customers.

chunks.zh: @sickoo 这么坑啊？
chunks.en: @sickoo Is it that bad?

chunks.zh: 有什么意义呢，就是下单了发货了也得春节后才能到了。
chunks.en: What's the point? Even if you place an order and it's shipped, it won't arrive until after the Spring Festival.

chunks.zh: 我联系快递公司投诉，感觉快递公司也是死猪不怕开水烫的样子，反正作为收件人也拿他没办法。
chunks.en: I contacted the courier company to complain, and it felt like the courier company didn't care at all. As the recipient, there's nothing I can do about it.

chunks.zh: 商家去问就说春节期间无法保证时效。
chunks.en: When the merchants ask, they say that delivery time cannot be guaranteed during the Spring Festival.

chunks.zh: 本来准备找一家不打烊的买点东西看了上面几楼，我还是再等等吧
chunks.en: I was originally going to find a store that was open during the Spring Festival to buy something, but after reading the above comments, I'll wait.

chunks.zh: 去年春节回家发现路由器坏了，大年初一赶忙 JD 下单一样，大年初二给我送到了
chunks.en: Last year, I went home for the Spring Festival and found that the router was broken. I hurriedly placed an order on JD on the first day of the Lunar New Year, and it was delivered to me on the second day.

chunks.zh: 繁花开过后，落下一地鸡毛
chunks.en: After the prosperity fades, only a mess remains.

chunks.zh: 大家有印象往年是从过年前多少天物流开始变慢的吗？
chunks.en: Does anyone remember how many days before the Spring Festival the logistics started to slow down in previous years?

chunks.zh: 我也是 31 日（腊月廿一）买了五六件东西，今天才到齐。
chunks.en: I also bought five or six items on the 31st (December 21st of the Lunar calendar), and they only arrived today.

chunks.zh: 还以为要到大年三十前几天才会变慢呢。
chunks.en: I thought it would only slow down a few days before New Year's Eve.

chunks.zh: 关键时候还是得京东。。。
chunks.en: When it matters, you still have to rely on JD...

chunks.zh: @evan9527 标注了春节不打烊的商家，发货都写的 24 小时或者 48 小时之内发货，剩下的商家都是 2 月 19 号前发货，但是，商家按时发货不等于快递按时送到。
chunks.en: @evan9527 Merchants who are labeled as open during the Spring Festival state that they will ship within 24 or 48 hours. The remaining merchants will ship before February 19th. However, merchants shipping on time does not mean deliveries will arrive on time.

chunks.zh: 淘宝可能是只是单纯的不想让平台的交易量在这个月少太多，体验差一点也就差一点了。
chunks.en: Taobao probably just doesn't want the platform's transaction volume to decrease too much this month. Even if the experience is a little worse, it's just a little worse.

chunks.zh: 搜了一下这个活动 22 年就有了，只能说当时他一家独大大家没办法只能忍，现在还敢搞，是怕自己死得不够快。
chunks.en: I searched and found that this event has been around since 2022. I can only say that they were dominant at the time, and everyone had no choice but to endure it. Now they still dare to do this, are they afraid of not dying fast enough?

chunks.zh: @wushan 我也觉得今年快递没往年给力，我记得前几年春节前五天还能正常收到三通一达的快递。
chunks.en: @wushan I also think that the delivery service this year is not as good as in previous years. I remember that in previous years, I could normally receive deliveries from STO, Yunda, YTO, and ZTO five days before the Spring Festival.

chunks.zh: 口罩一波干趴了？
chunks.en: Did the pandemic knock them off?

chunks.zh: 受害人报道，今年搞个不打烊，是历年来购物体验最差的一年，我大概一月 27 ，28 左右下的单，那快递接单后就不动，我不知道是快递在搞鬼还是商家，如无意外应该是快递，因为当天买前有问商家问题商家应该不会这样玩，这样搞如果我给个差评他更惨。
chunks.en: A victim reporting. This year's non-stop service is the worst shopping experience I've ever had. I placed an order around January 27th or 28th, and the delivery hasn't moved since the courier picked it up. I don't know if it's the courier or the merchant who are playing tricks. If there are no accidents, it would be the courier. It is less likely the merchant, because I asked the merchant a question before buying that day. If they did this and received a bad review it would be much worse for them.

chunks.zh: 以前卖就卖， 不卖就不卖，干净利落。
chunks.en: In the past, if they were selling, they sold. If they weren't selling, they weren't selling. It was clean and simple.

chunks.zh: 不过也帮平台说句话吧，万事起头难，第一年犯错但以后应该会好吧。
chunks.en: However, let me say a word for the platform, everything is difficult at the beginning, the first year made mistakes but it should be better in the future.

chunks.zh: @showgood163  买之前问清楚发不发货就行，还是有许多真的发的，我后来的就没问题，就前面 1 月底买那个上当。
chunks.en: @showgood163 Just ask clearly if they will ship before buying. There are still many that really ship. My later purchases are not problems. Only the one I bought at the end of January was a problem.

chunks.zh: @testonly 我在 B 站搜了一下，这个活动应该是 22 年开始的，所以今年是第三年了
chunks.en: @testonly I searched on Bilibili, and this event should have started in 2022, so this is the third year.

chunks.zh: @euph #16 也许不是今年开始，但今年很明显跟往年不一样，上年年底我也买了一堆，但上年绝大多数卖家会在页面写清楚自己那天放假，但今年许多都没写。
chunks.en: @euph #16 Maybe it didn't start this year, but this year is clearly different from previous years. I also bought a bunch of stuff at the end of last year, but most sellers clearly stated on the page when they would be on vacation, but many didn't write this year.

chunks.zh: 我上月底买那件，如果不是他们这样搞，我根本不会错过，当时根本大把都在正常发货，等我反应过来它不动时已经卖那玩意的已经停业得差不多了，多多上有人还在卖，但贵一大截，给那个快递玩死。
chunks.en: The thing I bought at the end of last month, if they hadn't done this, I wouldn't have missed it at all. At that time, there were many that were shipping normally. By the time I realized it wasn't moving, almost everyone selling that thing had stopped working, someone on Pinduoduo was still selling it, but it was much more expensive, killed by that courier.

chunks.zh: 其实到今天还在卖那些如果问了对方说还发货的，对方快递大概率是已经确定是能动的了，关键是看你收货这边快递送不送，我这边菜鸟好像过年也有人值班开下门，所以买前要问清楚发什么快递。
chunks.en: In fact, if you call the seller and ask about products that are still being sold today, and they say they will still ship the parcel, then that most likely means that they have confirmed that their partner courier is still working. The main point to consider is if the courier in your location is still delivering. It seems that the Cainiao delivery station in my area has someone on duty during this time, so you should always ask the seller which courier company they use.
